thread.title: Harbhajan says the pitch, not O'Keefe's bowling, the catalyst for India's loss
thread.title_full: Harbhajan says the pitch, not O'Keefe's bowling, the catalyst for India's loss

title: Harbhajan says the pitch, not O'Keefe's bowling, the catalyst for India's loss
text:
India v Australia: Harbhajan Singh will not praise Steve O'Keefe, says 'anyone' could take wickets on Pune pitch Posted February 26, 2017 18:09:38 Map: India 
Harbhajan Singh is still not convinced by India's Pune destroyer Steve O'Keefe, saying "anyone" could have taken wickets on the spinning pitch. 
Harbhajan, who before the series had predicted a 4-0 Indian whitewash and said this was the worst touring squad Australia had brought to the country, said the pitch, not O'Keefe's bowling, was the catalyst for the 333-run defeat. 
"I will have to see (O'Keefe) bowl on a good Test match wicket. Not this one. Until then, I will reserve my comments," Harbhajan told the Indian Express. 
"Test cricket should last five days. You cannot play on such wickets where anyone runs in to bowl and takes wickets. 
"I know how hard I had to work to earn every single wicket. 
"When you prepare such a wicket, you are making conditions favourable for the opposition ... you don't need to flight the ball or anything. You just need to bowl fast and not give the batsmen room."
